content.description: This is a hard (probably undone) line right of the Ice Age crack. The grade is a rough estimate.
content.protection: A good amount of pads. There is a large boulder directly under the route.
content.location: Use the ledge and a big undercling to get to the start holds. Start matched on a bad sharp crimp, and fire up to the sloping lip. Then top out, which looks pretty hard.*Once you pull onto the start holds, the big ledge at the bottom is off.

content.description: This is a sit start for Ice Age.
content.location: Start with both of your hands jammed in the flared crack. I think for most people it is thin hands. Do some awkward and hard moves into the start of Ice Age and finish.

content.description: This ascends the crack on the left side of the cliff.
content.location: Start standing with your hands in the crack and the flared mini-dihedral around it then climb up the crack. There are some small crimps higher up on the face to the left you can use.

content.description: This is a fun problem on the right side of Megley Overhangs. There are a verity of ways to go up this climb ranging from V1- to V2.
content.protection: Pads and maybe a spotter for the tree.
content.location: The climb is on the second to last chunk of rock on the right side. The climb goes up 2 boulders stacked on top of each other. Sit start on the bottom chunk, and go up the face. The topout is slightly easier on the right side arete.

content.description: This climbs the ripples on an overhanging chunk of rock in the middle right side of the cliff.Â
content.location: Start sitting in a separate block on a jug. Do a big move to a sidepull that faces the wrong way, and then do a few hard moves up on the crimps until topping out.

content.description: This is the overhang behind the Half Dome boulder. There is some big potential for some hard problems.
